Evidence Statements: The student can draw a picture showing what ice looks like before it is heated.
The student can draw a picture showing what ice looks like after it melts into water when heated.
The student can draw a picture showing what happens when the melted water is cooled back into ice.
The student can label their drawings to show the changes and reversibility of the ice and water.
The student can use drawings to support a claim that ice melting and refreezing is a reversible change.
